title: Biden’s Support for Iran Protesters Comes After Bitter Lessons of 2009
description: President Biden has quickly backed demonstrators in Iran. When the country faced similar unrest 13 years ago, U.S. officials feared such a strong approach would be counterproductive.

title: Women in Iran Take Center Stage in Antigovernment Protests
description: Women have been casting off their legally required head scarves, forming the primary image of the protests. But grievances against a repressive regime go far beyond the hijab.

title: Russia Admits to Draft Problems as Anger Flares Into Violence
description: The Kremlin’s spokesman tried to shift blame for errors in the call-up to regional agencies on Monday, the same day a gunman attacked a draft office in Siberia.

title: White House to Host France’s Macron in Biden’s First State Visit
description: After months of pandemic-related disruptions to President Biden’s diplomatic calendar, the White House is set to welcome the French president in December.

title: Canada Is Removing Strict Covid-19 Restrictions for Travelers
description: After two and a half years, Canada is dropping its remaining restrictions, including testing and quarantine requirements, effective Oct. 1.

title: Recruitment Officer Wounded in Russian Draft Office Shooting
description: A gunman opened fire at a draft office in a Siberian town, in what is believed to be the first attack on a military recruitment center since February to result in serious injury.

title: US Mountaineer Hilaree Nelson Is Missing in Nepal Avalanche
description: Hilaree Nelson, 49, appears to have fallen into a crevasse on Manaslu while attempting to ski from the summit. Separately, an avalanche killed at least one and left many injured.

title: Russia’s draft is targeting Crimean Tatars and other marginalized groups, according to activists.
Two Cities, Two Armies: Pivot Points in the Fight in Ukraine’s East
description: The battle for the critical Donbas region in Ukraine is centered on two strategically important cities: Lyman, held by the Russians, and Bakhmut, held by Ukraine. The fighting over the cities is fierce as both armies race to claim new ground.

title: Edward Snowden Receives Russian Citizenship
description: Mr. Snowden, a former intelligence contractor, left the United States after giving hundreds of highly classified N.S.A. documents to The Guardian and The Washington Post in 2013.

title: Hurricane Ian Could Gain Strength Rapidly. Here’s Why.
description: Storms that intensify quickly and unpredictably present a big problem for public safety officials, who have less time to assess threats.

title: Strong Dollar Is Good for the US but Bad for the World
description: The Federal Reserve may have no choice but to wage a relentless inflation fight, but countries rich and poor are feeling the pain of plunging currencies.

title: Iran Strikes at Kurdish Separatist Groups in Northern Iraq
description: The death of a young Iranian Kurdish woman in police custody has set off an intense wave of protests over the past 10 days and ignited a fury in the country’s Kurdish minority community.

title: Giorgia Meloni's Election Win in Italy: Here’s What To Know
description: Giorgia Meloni, leader of the hard-right Brothers of Italy, looked set to become prime minister after her party garnered more votes than any other.

title: Meloni Faces Early Test of Italy’s Resolve on Russia and Ukraine
description: The hard-right leader Giorgia Meloni has been a full-throated supporter of Ukraine, but her coalition partners have sounded like apologists for Vladimir V. Putin.

title: 4 Years After Thrilling Cave Rescue, Sleepy Park Readies for Onslaught
description: An unheralded national park in Thailand was the center of global attention when 12 boys were trapped in a cave there. In the wake of major movies about the rescue, the park expects a visitor surge.

title: Gunman Attacks Draft Office as Russian Unrest Over Call-Ups Deepens
description: Anger is mounting in Russia over President Vladimir V. Putin’s mobilization of hundreds of thousands of civilians as his military struggles in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine Honors Slain Soldier Whose Bracelet Made Him a Symbol
description: Serhiy Sova, 36, was honored as a Hero of Ukraine by President Volodymyr Zelensky. His body was found in a mass grave in Izium.

title: Yevgeny Prigozhin, a Putin Ally, Says He Founded Russia’s Wagner Group
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, a Russian businessman and close associate of President Vladimir V. Putin, confirmed his role weeks after he was seen in a recruitment video for the private military company.

title: Giorgia Meloni Wins Voting in Italy, in Breakthrough for Europe’s Hard Right
description: Her nationalist party was the top vote-getter, leaving Ms. Meloni poised to be Italy’s first female prime minister and the first with post-Fascist roots.

title: Iran’s Ferocious Dissent
description: Times reporters make sense of what’s happening.

title: Europe Looks at Italy’s Giorgia Meloni With Caution and Trepidation
description: Giorgia Meloni, poised to be the country’s first far-right leader since Mussolini, says she supports Ukraine and has moderated her harsh views on Europe, but there are doubts, given her partners.

title: At Least 9 Killed in School Shooting in Russia, Including Children
description: An unidentified gunman entered a school in the city of Izhevsk, killing two security guards, two teachers and at least five minors, according to federal investigators.

title: For China’s Auto Market, Electric Isn’t the Future. It’s the Present.
description: More electric cars will be sold in the country this year than in the rest of the world combined, as its domestic market accelerates ahead of the global competition.

title: Monkeypox Appears to Recede, but Risks and Uncertainties Linger
description: Scientists do not yet know how well the vaccine and the drug used to treat the infection are working. Two new trials will provide answers.

title: To Defend Democracy, Is Brazil’s Top Court Going Too Far?
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court has acted as the primary check on President Jair Bolsonaro’s power. Now many are worried the court is posing its own threat.

title: Zelensky urges allies to step up pressure on Putin amid ‘nuclear blackmail.’
Your Monday Briefing
description: Elections in Italy.

title: Giorgia Meloni Leads Voting in Italy, in Breakthrough for Europe’s Hard Right
description: Early results suggested her nationalist party would be the top vote-getter, leaving Ms. Meloni poised to be Italy’s first female prime minister and the first with post-Fascist roots.

title: U.S. Warns Russia of ‘Catastrophic Consequences’ if It Uses Nuclear Weapons
description: The comments by the national security adviser, Jake Sullivan, illustrate how quickly the rhetoric has intensified as Russia has faltered on the battlefield in recent months.
